intro: Erigeron pseudoacris, commonly known as the plains fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, fields, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pale yellow to white. Erigeron pseudoacris is known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
